intro: Ptilotus conicus, commonly known as the "Coneflower" or "Coral flower," is a flowering plant native to Australia. It is a member of the Goodeniaceae family and is characterized by its distinctive conical or tubular flower clusters. The plant produces showy, colorful inflorescences that range from pink to red, often with a striking contrast between the petals and the central stamens. Ptilotus conicus is typically found in sandy or rocky soils and is adapted to arid and semi-arid environments. It is often cultivated for its ornamental value and is also used in traditional Aboriginal practices.
